heading: amazon's holiday bonanza
subheading: the online retailer says it sold us$250 million worth of goodies during the holidays, but will still lose a bundle on the quarter.
author: reuters
text: amazon.com said tuesday its fourth-quarter sales reached us$250 million, over three-and-a-half times last year's levels, or $1 billion on an annualized basis. while the online retailer's sales figure for the quarter topped analysts' estimates of between $175 and $200 million for the quarter, some had suggested the figure could range closer to $270 million.amazon.com (amzn) cautioned that the higher seasonal sales will not translate into reduced losses for the fourth quarter. the company said significant music and video sales and aggressive product pricing lowered profit margins. amazon will release a detailed earnings report in late january.amazon's share price inched up 63 cents to $118.94 by late morning on the nasdaq.over a million new customers shopped at amazon.com during the holiday shopping season of 17 november to 31 december. during that time the company shipped over 7.5 million items, more than it shipped during all of 1997."we had more business than our most optimistic projections," said jeff bezos, the company's founder and chief executive.it remains to be seen whether amazon can translate its burgeoning sales into profits.since going public, amazon.com, like many other internet firms, has consistently lost money as its plows cash into expanding its reach. nevertheless, investors have flocked to the company, driving the shares up from under $10 a year ago to close at over $118 monday, adjusted for stock splits.
